newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Robotics unveils x2 upgrade program.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Robotics unveils x2 upgrade program.

text.p: U.S. Robotics Corp on Thursday unveiled a program for upgrading modems to its new faster "x2" technology, including some free upgrades.

The x2 technology allows users to download information from the Internet and other networks at speeds of 56 kilobits per second over regular analog phone lines, twice as fast as today's common connection.
U.S. Robotics said customers with remote access servers, modem pools and Courier desktop modems purchased between October 1 and December 31, 1996 will be eligible for a free upgrade.
For products purchased as of January 1, x2 upgrades will be priced at about $60 to $95 per port, U.S. Robotics said.

The upgrade will be in the form of a software and will not require a change in chip or equipment. U.S. Robotics said software upgrades for Courier products will be available in January and for Total Control Enterprise Network Hubs in February. Upgrades for other systems are expected in February and March, depending on the product.
U.S. Robotics said it will offer additional upgrades once a standard for the 56 kbps technology is established.
Pricing and upgrade information for the Sporster modems has yet to be announced, a spokeswoman for the company said.
